situation: I can't stand him!!!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello. How are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I used to love my boyfriend, but now I can't stand him. Why has this happened and how to break up with him without hurting his feelings much?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What changed to bring you to the point you can't stand him?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just find him extremely annoying. How he walks, talks, breathes even... I should have walked away from him earlier.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: He is very respectful, committed, sweet and loving, but I just don't feel anything towards him anymore.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That sounds like a really difficult and uncomfortable situation to be in.

dialog.content: How long have you been together?

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: We've been together for 3 years.
persona: my boyfriend and I have been together for 3 years.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: And he wants to get married and have children. It makes me anxious. I'm not ready for those things.
persona: my boyfriend wants to get married and have children.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It's good you know where you're at and what you do, and do not, want.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: How do I tell my boyfriend that I don't want to be him anymore???? How do I break up???

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I don't want him to hate me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: When ending a relationship, we're not responsible for the other person's emotions. Whatever they feel, they feel, and we can't control that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You need to do what is best for you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: How about me? Will I regret breaking up with him? I've became a better person since we've met.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You might try talking to him and seeing if he has any awareness of your unhappiness, of you discomfort with his pushing for marriage and children when you're not ready.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel guilty to hurt his feelings and at the same time it pisses me off even more!
persona: i feel guilty to hurt his feelings but at the same time it pisses me off even more.
it makes me anxious to be alone.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A good friend once told me that all normal, sane people feel guilt when ending a relationship when they're not happy. There is no pleasure in breaking someone's heart, especially when they haven't done anything really wrong.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You're right. I should talk about it with him openly and tell him how I really feel.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds like you're maybe not 100% certain you want to end things. That's where talking to him becomes important.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Maybe I'm afraid of being alone. Maybe things could have been different if it weren't for COVID. Maybe we spend TOO much time together.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: And, if you do have a talk with him and later it becomes clear the relationship still can't work, it won't hit him as such a surprise when you choose to end things.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: And, if you do have a talk with him and later it becomes clear the relationship still can't work, it won't hit him as such a surprise when you choose to end things.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: COVID has put a huge strain on a lot of relationships. People are stuck spending way more time together than they are used to, and there's really not much to do about it right now.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you so much for listening me out and for wise advice. I will talk to him, tonight.

situation: I have been suffering from general anxiety which gets worse at nights. Sometimes, I cannot pay attention to my work and feel of depressed, anxious, and so on. I look for some help to relieve from the current situation.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: hi there how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi, doing OK. how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am not so bad. Is there anything you'd like to talk about?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am having difficulty in controlling my anxiety and look for some support.
persona: i have trouble controlling my anxiety.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah I hear you, I have suffered bad anxiety for years. Have you been getting medical help?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Not really, although I got some medication prescribed, however, am very afraid of getting addicted and reliance.
persona: i am afraid of getting addicted to medication.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Some anti anxiety medication can be addictive but if you're sensible with it you should be okay. Talk to your doctor?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, she suggested so. But I am not convinced.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I see many friends getting relying on the medication even after they feel OK.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What about counselling .. would you consider that? There is some very good therapy available

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I haven't thought about it...maybe not familiar with the circumstance.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Maybe different culture that I have grown?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I also have many friends who were not satisfied with counseling.
persona: we have a lot of friends who are not happy with the way we are being treated.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: True - I know different cultures do take different approaches to things and in some places talking about mental health is taboo

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have no idea what to do.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: that's why I look for another support.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would recommend giving counselling a go, even though you're not totally sure about it

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: what if it doesn't work and cost a lot?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is it not possible to get it free? It is provided free in my country

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: very costy here in the US

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah, you need to move here to the UK ;)

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: also varying by the healthcare providers.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I didn't know that the UK has such a good coverage.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: We don't have to worry about the cost of medication or counselling as we have socialised medicine

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: can you please explain further about socialized medicine?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Sure. Everyone pays a small percentage of their income - depending on how much they earn - and it goes to fund the NHS. Everyone is therefore eligible for free hospital treatment etc and we pay a standard amount (about ten pounds ie fourteen dollars) for a prescription, no matter which drugs we are gettign

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If I needed a heart transplant tomorrow it would be free :D

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I see. That's how South Korea manage healthcare too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Most of Europe do it that way. It works well :)

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: However, the US healthcare system is totally different, so commercialized.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: that's why I look for supporters today.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: At least you'd be sure you'd be able to get help for your anxiety!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: sure thing!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Alas yes, it's a very scary system. Too many people suffer cos they can't get insurance or pay their bills

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes, it is so sad even if I have a health insurance from my workplace, but we have to pay from out of pocket, which is ridiculous.
persona: my family and I pay out of pocket for our health insurance.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you have any other suggestions to resolve my anxiety issue?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes it really is - I can imagine that that sends your anxiety sky high. We just don't have to worry about that - we pay in advance and no more than we can afford

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Well, how about Vitamin B? Strangely, it actually does work

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am currently taking, but still not effective.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you need quite a large dose each day - regular won't do anything

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: How large?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I take one of the over the counter products.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am probably not supposed to give medical advice :) But have a look online

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I see.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But thanks, I may look up that info.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Sounds like you've been dealing with a lot lately, which can impact your sleep. Have you had any difficulties sleeping, either too much or too little recently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My sleep? Well, it's hardly there at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand. Has there been frequent times lately, where you felt little interest or pleasure in activities?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I can't recall experiencing such symptoms frequently or even occasionally.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds tough, have you often felt down, depressed, or hopeless lately?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: To answer your question, I can honestly say that feelings of being down, depressed, or hopeless aren't that prevalent in my daily life.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I see, do you often feel tired or have little energy to do things?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I can't say that I've ever experienced any symptoms related to constant fatigue or low energy levels.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Quite frequently, do you feel you've let down your family or yourself?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I cannot recall experience any instances where I felt I've disappointed my family or myself.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you often find yourself eating too little or too much?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: In response to your query, I should clarify that I've never experienced such drastic changes in my eating habits or patterns.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand your struggles. Have others remarked on your unusual restlessness or slow movement lately?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, throughout my battle with anxiety, I've never exhibited any signs of unusual restlessness or slow movement which could be observed by others.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Your feelings matter. Have you been having thoughts of being better off not around, or hurting yourself, lately?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I haven't been experiencing any thoughts of self-harm or feeling that I'd be better off not existing. Those symptoms are not something I've encountered.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It's important to talk openly. Do you often have trouble concentrating on activities, such as reading or watching TV?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Answering your question, I regret to say that for a significant number of days, I have often had trouble concentrating on activities like reading or watching television.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You're welcome.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter

persona: my dream job is at a conference center owned by my church denomination.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you.  I believe there are three things in my favor:  I know the job well, as I became friends with the person I would be replacing, My pastor wrote a glowing reference, and I was also able to get a reference from the person who trained me for my current (related) job fifteen years ago.
persona: my pastor wrote a glowing reference for me when I applied for the job.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: even by working there, you will surely meet new friends. do you know many people from the church?

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: wow! Olympic size pool. Keep praying. the job is yours.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: At this facility, there are beautiful benches to sit and watch the moon and stars and enjoy the sunrise or just take a moment.  There are covered gazebos and a couple buildings have deep covered porches for days when it's a bit rainy or the sun is strong.

situation: I wish I had a girlfriend. I haven't seen any friends outside of my household since last October!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello. How are you? What would you like to talk about?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Got any advice for a lonely single fellow in his mid thirties? I miss my friends, and virtual meetings on Zoom don't feel the same as meeting in person!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The pandemic has been hard on many people, those in relationships and those looking for new ones! Have you tried to develop a new hobby or interest that you can do with others once the pandemic is over?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, I've been writing enough poetry to publish a book, so I'll certainly do that. I know the pandemic has been rough for everyone. Hopefully my doctor will say I qualify for the vaccine soon.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Getting my stimulus check in the next week or so would certainly make me a bit happier, too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's great! Poetry is something you can share in person or over video link. What about physical activities? I think that yoga might be something that you can do by yourself and with others. There are a bunch of videos on sites like YouTube.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A stimulus check! Yes, we can all use money during these trying times.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Oh, I took advantage of virtual yoga and zumba early on during the pandemic. Friends had virtual classes. Eventually they were able to go back to work. Being disabled is a poverty trap for a lot of people, not just me. I really want to find a girlfriend once I get vaccinated.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have tried yoga myself, but it wasn't really my thing. I prefer walking and riding a bike.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you have to wait until you get vaccinated to start working on getting a girlfriend?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, certain things don't work for every person.
persona: my voice in my head tells me that I am not good enough.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is there a way you could start looking for a girlfriend online now, before the pandemic is over?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Maybe there is a way to make a connection using your poetry.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Technically, no, I don't HAVE to wait to get vaccinated, but then again, maybe I don't want a girlfriend. The only one I had ten years ago in college wanted to marry me and have a child and I wasn't ready for commitment. I fear marriage, actually.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Marriage is a big step, and any prudent person would think carefully before making the commitment.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's a good point, I'm sure if my poetry is entertaining or full of truth about my experiences in a wheelchair, perhaps a woman will find that attractive

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Are you concerned that things will move too quickly to that level of commitment (marriage)? You could make it clear from the outset that you want to take it slow.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But it's better than being alone

dialog.content: Robin Williams talked about that situation.

situation: My manager has decided that everyone will continue to work from home nearly 100% of the time after the pandemic is under control. (Prior to the pandemic, most of us only had one work-from-home day a week.) I really love the work I do, but I've been experiencing depression this past year largely due to my lack of human contact throughout the work day.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi, how are you? What would you like to talk about today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi - I'm sorry. I stepped away from the computer for a moment while waiting...

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's quite all right. The wait times can be a bit long. How are you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, my manager has decided that everyone in the office will continue to work from after the pandemic is under control. But I've found myself depressed from working from home all the time.
persona: my manager has decided that everyone in the office will continue to work from home after the pandemic is under control.
i have found myself depressed from working from home all the time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Working from home is not what people expected. Many have found themselves isolated. They miss the interaction of the office. How long have you bee working from home?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: For a full year--since March 2020, when the pandemic first started. I was working from home just 1 day per week prior to that, which I liked. But I've found that 5 days per week is much too much. I miss people. :(

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you and your co-workers talked to your boss about a hybrid schedule, maybe a couple days a week in the office? That might work.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's where it gets awkward. It seems like everyone besides me are super happy that we'll continue working from home. I hesitate to share my feelings because maybe my manager will change her mind, which would be a big bummer for everyone else on the team (seemingly).

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I see. That's a concern. So you feel that if one person goes in to the office, then everyone else will have to? There won't be any flexibility?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, it's possible that my manager will say we can be flexible. But if so, I think I'd end up being the only one in my office working... which would be just as lonely as working from home while throwing away the few perks of working from home, like saving on gas. Plus, I think my company will probably want to repurpose our office space eventually.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: lol, sorry, that was an ugly run-on sentence. :\

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hm. A bit of a dilemma. Can this situation go on forever though? Maybe the boss will extend the stay-at-home for a while, but when other companies go back to the office, the expectation will be there for all companies.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Other employees might change their minds bit by bit as well.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is indeed a possibility. But my office is in a city that has a whole lot of high-tech companies, which were moving towards doing more work from home even BEFORE the pandemic. So it kind of feels like this might be a "cultural shift" in my area in general. Although there has GOT to be a whole lot of other people who feel like I do. Maybe we should start our own company, lol.
persona: my office is in a city that has a lot of high-tech companies.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: True. I don't think you are alone. Is there something that you can do to make working at home better for you? More frequent breaks? Better work space?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's a good question. My state is still one of the ones that's mostly shut-down. Part of my depression surely stems from the fact that all evening/weekend activities ended a year ago as well.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: True. It might be easier to work at home when you have a chance to get out of the house during your free time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's true. And your suggestion of improving my work space is a good one. I've been working in a modified walk-in closet. I've tried to make it inviting, but there are no windows/etc.... it's kind of a dark cave.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Most people didn't plan for the long term because nobody thought that this was a sustainable way to work. By the way, if your company wants you to stay home, then it might help buy the equipment you need to be productive.

dialog.speaker: seeker

persona: my daughter struggles with school work and memory.
i have tried to contact the school many times over the years but to no avail.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You have tried hard to help her and that is admirable. Don't beat yourself up and be proud of the things you have done for her.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But what do I now. She's 17 and it's so difficult to give her the time and then  encourage her to tell me when she needs help and for her to be willing to accept it.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: While I do not have kids, from what I have seen my friends and family do in this situation is try to find something that your daughter is interested in and attempt to build off of that. So instead of her learning to just learn, she is learning something that is relevant to her. Maybe that might spark something in her to come up with her way of learning since traditional methods aren't working.

situation: I lost my job 4 month ago and I am running out of money.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello, how are you doing today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I was looking for some assistance. I lost my job 4 month ago
persona: i lost my job 4 months ago and am looking for a new one.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Losing your job is one of the biggest stressors in life, how have you been handling it?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well first few month was kind off alright, Was looking for a job in different places without success. And now I am really depressed and I feel so useless.
persona: my rent is too high and I don t have any friends to help me out.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know what it's like to lose a job, and when it's hard to find a new one it can really make you feel low. What activities have you been doing in addition to seeking new employment?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Nice that you understand me, I was trying job websites alongside with jobcenter in town centre. I have jobseeker allowance but it will not cover the rent

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am living in a high-rent city and the only way I was able to keep my apartment was to find a roommate. Are there ways you can get help from friends or family until a new job opens up?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am renting just a room at the moment, Before I had a girlfriend so we had to split the bill. After she left I had to take all responsibility just on myself to pay bills. I have few friends but don't think they could lend me a lot of money anyway

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: One possible solution, if it's possible for you, could be to sub-lease your room to someone else and stay with friends or family. Even if they can't loan you money, they may be able to let you stay with them for a week while you make money renting your room as an airbnb.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Oh AirBnB might be a solution actually. I will speak to my cousin if I could stay couple of nights at his place.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What sort of employment are you looking for? Perhaps we can brainstorm some places you can go to make connections for potential work.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I was working in IKEA warehouse before I got redundant

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Working in a warehouse shows you have great skills for several other types of jobs. Have you checked small independent-contractor sites like TaskRabbit or Lyft to make extra funds while you search for a new permanent job?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I even haven't heard about those. I am really useless sometimes... What kind of jobs I can find there do you know?
persona: sometimes I feel useless and that I am not good enough to live on my own.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Well, if you didn't know about them, that's not your fault. It's possible that you could find a new job opportunity while working on smaller tasks or by volunteering for a local organization. You could meet new folks who could provide you with new connections for employment!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I Will definitely try that. You are really helpful. Have you been doing any jobs through those websites?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes I am able to make a little spending money by doing small tasks like delivering real estate papers, or delivery take-out food. You can google a list of sites like RentSons.com where you can sign up to do an assortment of tasks, and your warehouse skills will come in handy!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's cool, I feel now a lot better. Maybe I will be able to find even a girlfriend somewhere on those jobs. I feel lonely after my girlfriend left me

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: We all feel lonely when life gets hard, but getting yourself out there to do tasks will help you feel useful AND you could meet your future wife, you never know! I wish you the absolute best!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you very much for you help. I learned something new today and feel much better

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It's good to hear you're feeling more confident. Can you tell me, have you often been feeling as though you're not good enough or have failed in some ways?

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter
